metadata.title: CVE-2020-14983 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
The server in Chocolate Doom 3.0.0 and Crispy Doom 5.8.0 doesn't validate the user-controlled num_players value, leading to a buffer overflow. A malicious user can overwrite the server's stack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-14983` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chocolate-doom - 3.0.1-1
No subscription required

crispy-doom - 5.9.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chocolate-doom package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.1-1').
crispy-doom package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.9.0-1').
